title: Lordsilvabtc
author: Lordsilvabtc
content: If you've been on Binance over the years, you couldProbably discover that in simple terms it is the most securedWell coordinated and organized centralized exchange globally,The recent announcement of wallet addresses going to expiration,Has got me wondering, What effects, positive or negative will this have on Binance platform as well as the crypto investors and traders On the platform, As for me I found it strange, that an address is expiring. What are your takes on this.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.created_time: May 19, 2023, 11:36:27 PMLast edit: May 19, 2023, 11:47:53 PM by Nwada001
comments.body: I don't think their will be any form of negative impact which the change of address can actually cause, I believe the change of address is as a result of their security upgrade on those listed network, and for the time being notification were all forwarded to all their users which is enough reason and time for them to go claim their new address. Their are already lots of threads regarding this Binance change of address, using the forum search button would have been nicer and saved you repeated topic Creation..I will advice you lock up this thread in other not to take the discussion any more further. Edit:  [Binance] Address expiration?  Binance User

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: There shouldn't be any course for alarm nd I've also raised a similar topic in the past week and I don't think there will any harm if coin is sent to the old address but I also think that binance should simply just do an automatic change in the address without having to keep the minds of its customers restless.I also think based on the responses I got on my thread that there might still be an option for one to transfer their funds from the previous address to the new one just incase the need be.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: By "expiring" they probably mean they are trying to change to a new wallet with a new set of seeds or keys and leaving the old one which is a good security practice. So when they see the address is "expiring", it is not actually expiring but they are discouraging you from using it in the futureKucoin did such a thing in the past when they got hacked so it's no surprise.If you notice, Ethereum and tron addresses on Binance are the ones being retired. I think the new addresses that are being implemented are an upgrade from the ones that were prone to the zero value transaction scam that has been going on for a while.

What are your takes on this.There will be no effect from their current users or to those who are going to make an account on them.And they are not short of notifying users about the said upgrade, and they are still willing to help those who unfortunately forget about this and send it to their old address.Everything is laid out here: https://www.binance.com/en/support/faq/why-is-my-deposit-address-being-retired-853aaedc7f45430283abc7a25713c428QuoteBinance continuously upgrades its wallet infrastructure to provide better efficiency and fund security for users. As such, weâ€™re retiring deposit addresses and memos still on the old infrastructure in batches.You'll receive an email if your deposit address and memo are affected. We strongly encourage users to retrieve a new deposit address upon receiving the email.

What are your takes on this.As a user, you must follow announcement from the exchange. Wallet expiration, address changes are only two of many changes on one exchange when it operates many years.I don't see effect from this for careful people as it only changes your receiving address. Like when you create your account, receiving addresses won't be created instantly for your account. You must click on Create to get one receiving address so the same for change address. You don't lose your cryptocurrency in your account even you don't touch your new receiving address.But it is different if you want to make deposits to your account by yourself or in a trade with other partners. You must get your receiving address, a new one, with this wallet upgrade from Binance.

I believe Binance will automatically offer a new address when the current one expires, and the notification will only serve to inform customers of the address change. comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: As Binance has explained, this is supposed to be for the enhancement of their technology infrastructure. So if that's what it is, then there's no problem. It is for the improvement of the platform's services and security. And it's also good that even with an expired address you can still receive your deposits, although with additional clicks. But it's not really a hassle. What concerns me, however, is when Binance disables this "click to credit" function. It's not a matter of if; it's a matter of when. It will eventually happen. I hope Binance will issue an announcement long before they will finally remove this function. Surely, there will still be stuck funds though. Will they be Binance's already?

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Did you read the last advertisement, or is it an analysis from you, because there is no news in it about any loss of money related to it, and therefore there is no effect. In the end, this is not a hack or a reporting of the loss of money.Binance has a long history of activities that may be more dangerous than this such as not having their headquarters, trying to hide their location of registration, their problems with US regulations, a lot of abuse claims, listing some fraudulent coins, and causing FTX drama.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Over the year, Binance got a lot of users but was not the most secure or well coordinated exchange; there were other trusted exchanges and dex like Binance too, but it was just that Binance was one of the tier one exchanges based on market cap and trading volume. That doesn't define it as best security or coordinated.Â Perhaps the expiration of those deposit wallet addresses is nothing strange, or would you have suggested if they didn't tell any of their users if there were any changes in their exchange? I might not be aware of the real reason why they renewed those deposit addresses, but for about two years that I have used Binance, I have not received any wallet expiration messages, so I believe there was a valid reason why they made those changes.

comments.author: uchegod-21
comments.body: I have read and seen Binance do so many things and most times things they do are not bitcoin things and it looks as if they are not bitcoin minded because of their level of centralization. But in this case of address expiry, it is one thing they have done that supports bitcoin way. To be privacy centred, it is not good to use one wallet over and over again. So, wallet expiry will make it possible to use one address for one type of transaction only. And that is for security reasons. I was just imagining if they included bitcoin addresses in the announcements. The weekly btc payment in the forum.

comments.author: BitDane
comments.body: The changing of wallet address of Binance is a good move, IMO.Â  they should alsoÂ  implemente the option for changing an address every time a deposit is done for security reason.Â  I do not think any negative implication of address change except for the users who do not update themselves and keep on using the old address to receive funds for other people after it expires.Â  Although the fund might not be lost but it will be cumbersome if the sent fund is not credited to his account since he needs to contact the support staff and file a ticket about the problem.Â  Depending on how the staff will act on the issue, it may take some working days to be resolved.

I don't think it will have any negative effect on the customers because even funds in the expired address are still safe and can still be access
